title: Malformed .BSP Access Violation in CS:GO can lead to Remote Code Execution
content:
A malformed .BSP can trigger an Access Violation on CS:GO that can lead to arbitrary code execution on a remote computer. I have attached a copy of the malformed .BSP which reliably triggers an Access Violation on CS:GO.
Impact
An attacker hosting a malicious server could compromise a remote client by having them download a custom map, triggering remote code execution on the victim's computer.
steps: Create or obtain a malformed .BSP file designed to trigger an access violation in CS:GO.
Host a malicious CS:GO server and configure it to serve the malformed .BSP file to clients.
Have a victim connect to the malicious server, which will force the client to download the malformed .BSP file.
Observe the access violation on the victim's client, potentially leading to remote code execution.
vuln_description: A malformed .BSP file can trigger an access violation in CS:GO, leading to arbitrary code execution on a remote computer when a victim connects to a malicious server hosting the file.
reason: The vulnerability involves understanding the .BSP file format, identifying a malformation that triggers an access violation, and leveraging this to achieve remote code execution. While the concept of file parsing vulnerabilities is common, crafting a reliable exploit requires deep knowledge of the game's engine and file handling mechanisms.
